content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at Position (1.5, 19.5)
Consists of:
• Cable Factory Input Chest at Position (2.5, 17.5)
• Factory Burner Inserter at Position (3.5, 17.5) with a drop position at (4.5, 17.5)
• Assembling Machine (assembling-machine-1) at Position (1.5, 19.5)
Use-case: Converts copper plates into copper cables within the factory interface.

### Belt Depot for Extraction Connection at Position (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of:
• Depot Wooden Chest (serving as belt depot) at Position (3.5, 15.5)
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at Position (4.5, 15.5) adjacent to the chest
• Depot Burner Inserter at Position (3.5, 14.5) using direction UP
Use-case: Provides a reliable intermediary depot for transferring resources from the extraction system into the cable factory.

### Extraction System at Position (–3.5, 27.5)
Consists of:
• Extraction Burner Inserter at Position (–3.5, 27.5) with a drop position at (–3.5, 28.5)
Use-case: Delivers extracted copper plates from the mining area to the belt network.

### Electricity Generation Structure at Position (–0.5, 24.5)
Consists of:
• Steam Engine (Generator) at Position (–0.5, 24.5) 
• Boiler at Position (–5.5, 24.0)
• Offshore Pump at Position (–7.5, 25.5)
Use-case: Produces electrical power for factory components and connected systems.

ERROR TIPS
───────────
• Transport Belt Connection Errors  
  – Error: “Transport belts cannot be connected directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine object as a target.”  
  – Tip: Always connect belts to an inserter (or another compatible intermediary) rather than directly targeting a steam engine.

• Placement Distance Issues  
  – Error: “Could not place wooden-chest at (3.5, 15.5)…The target position is too far away.”  
  – Tip: Ensure you are within the maximum placement range by moving closer to the target position before attempting to place the entity.

• Inventory and Variable Reference Mistakes  
  – Error: “No wooden_chest in inventory.”  
  – Tip: Verify that the required item is available in your inventory prior to placement.  
  – Error: “NameError: name 'target_chest' is not defined.”  
  – Tip: Double-check variable names and ensure that all required identifiers are correctly defined and referenced.
